Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BG-CATH29 (natural AMPs; toad, amphibians, animals; 1S=S,  UCSS1a; Alternative form? BG-CATH25)

Literature.Author: Zhan B, Gao YY, Lin WP, Jia GT, Sun TY, Lee WH. 2017
Literature.Reference: Zhongguo Zhong Yao Za Zhi. 2016 Feb;41(4):630-635. doi: 10.4268/cjcmm20160414.PubMed
Literature.Title: [Identification and bactericidal activity of a novel Cathelicidin family member from skin of Bufu bufo gargarizans] (in Chinese)

Sequence Information.Comments: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 38.7% similarity toAscaphin-6.  Molecular formula:  C138H239N39O40S3; Mol Wt 3206.826; GRAVY= -0.85; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:  12.8  kcal/mol.Activity: Active against Gram- bacterium A. hydrophila (MIC 10 mg/L). BG-CATH25, obtained after deleting the N-terminal four residues, is more active (MIC 1.25). APD comment: Which is the native form remains to be established by Edman degradation of the purified peptide. Updated 7/2020
